author.persName: Muhammad Hasan b. Muhammad 'Ali (known as 'Ali Muhammad Khan).

msItem.title: Mir'at-i Ahmadi.
msItem.note: F1a: signature of Ellis, dated 14 Dec. 1891, F1b, and inside front cover: signature E E Pote. (Edward Ephraim Pote left a large number of Persian manuscripts acquired in India to Eton and King's Colleges. See the catalogue of the Eton collection by D.S. Margoliouth [Oxford 1904].) Inside back cover: No. 1639. Cat. Wm Patel Esq: of Peterborough. sold by Leigh & Sotheby on December 1810. A history of Gujarat. The manuscript contains the final part of the work, beginning with events of 1158. Headings and punctuation in red, also some names.
msItem.incipit: Incipit, heading: Amadan-i Khandi Rau bana bar fara ham awardan

listBibl.bibl: Other copies in the collection: Codrington/Reade Nos 82-5.

bindingDesc.p: Brown half-leather and painted board binding.

origin.p: Sunday 4 Jumada II, regnal year 26 of Shah 'Alam, A.H. 1200.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
